meanings.definition: Covered in soft, fluffy feathers or fur
meanings.sent1: The baby chick was the downiest creature I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The bunny's downiest coat kept it warm in the cold winter.
meanings.sent3: The downiest kitten purred contentedly in its cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: Her downiest scarf felt like a cloud wrapped around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The downiest clouds floated lazily across the sky.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of energy or enthusiasm
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, he felt his downiest when he got home.
meanings.sent2: The students looked downiest on the last day of school.
meanings.sent3: Even the downiest puppy perked up when it saw its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: Her downiest expression brightened when she saw her best friend.
meanings.sent5: The downiest sloth moved slowly through the trees.

meanings.definition: Located at a lower level or position
meanings.sent1: The basement was the downiest part of the house.
meanings.sent2: The downiest shelf in the cupboard held the heavy pots.
meanings.sent3: The downiest step creaked under his weight as he descended.
meanings.sent4: The downiest drawer in the dresser was hard to open.
meanings.sent5: The downiest row in the theater had the best view of the stage.
